thread.title: Devon Conservative MP Anne Marie Morris has whip restored after 'n r in the woodpile' comment

author: Richard Booth
title: Devon Conservative MP Anne Marie Morris has whip restored after 'n r in the woodpile' comment
text:
News Devon Conservative MP Anne Marie Morris has whip restored after 'n r in the woodpile' comment Anne Marie Morris has been given the whip back this afternoon after being recorded saying the Brexit deal is a “real n r in the woodpile”. Share Richard Booth Head of content 16:37, 12 DEC 2017 Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get Daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Anne Marie Morris has been given the whip back this afternoon after being recorded saying the Brexit deal is a “real n r in the woodpile”. 
Ms Morris, who has been the MP for Newton Abbot since 2010, described the UK leaving the EU without a deal as a “real n r in the woodpile” at the launch of a report into the future for the UK’s financial sector after Brexit. 
She apologised for the remarks, saying: “The comment was unintentional and I apologise unreservedly for any offence caused.” 
But she had the whip suspended by her party, which meant that although she was still an MP, she was no longer a Conservative MP. Read More Boundary Commission changes - what it means for Devon's residents 
That was restored on Tuesday. 
The Conservative MP said today: “I would like to take this opportunity to apologise again for using such inappropriate and offensive language. The whip has been returned to me today. I feel proud and privileged to be a Conservative Member of Parliament and I will continue to serve my community and my country to the best of my ability” Anne Marie Morris (left) and Theresa May (right) 
Earlier this year Prime Minister Theresa May refused to answer the question as to whether Ms Morris would be allowed made into the Conservative Party in the future when she was asked explicitly by ITV’s Political Correspondent David Wood at her party's annual conference in Manchester. 
She said: “You know why we took the decision that we did and she is suspended, and obviously from time to time we will look at the situation. 
“We have suspended her because what she said was wrong and it was inappropriate for her to say what she said. 
“I was concerned when I heard about the remarks which is why I took the action I did.” Read More Where does the phrase 'N****r in the woodpile' used by Anne Marie Morris come from? 
But when asked whether as an elected official she could return to the Conservative Party after using the language that she did, the Prime Minister reiterated that the Newton Abbot MP is 'suspended'. 
Newton Abbot Conservatives backed Ms Morris and said that although her remarks were inappropriate, they won’t be calling for her resignation, although Cllr John Hart, the Conservative leader of Devon County Council did say that she needed to ‘consider her position’ as a result of her comments.
